title: Why the Brexit deal will reverse Britain's property market slump
text:
Confidence is crucial when it comes to property deals, and the recent loss of faith in the market has been attributed to Brexit-related uncertainty.

In the three years since the vote there has been a reduction in the number of homes being put up for sale, ever-growing transaction times and a decline in annual house price growth as negotiations between Britain and the European Union have dragged on.

However, with the relative certainty presented by a deal, analysts believe that buyers and sellers will soon return to the market.

Patrick Alvarado, of London estate agency Nicolas Van Patrick, said: “With a deal, those holding off putting their properties up for sale to avoid low offers will come...
description: Confidence is crucial when it comes to property deals, and the recent loss of faith in the market has been attributed to Brexit-related uncertainty.
